Speaker: KRATOS
Text: This... cannot be. Why? Why would you do this?

Speaker: MOTHER
Text: Your father forbid me to tell you.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: My father? Who is my father?
[GAMEPLAY]

Speaker: MOTHER
Text: Finally, I am free, find your brother… Kratos, go to… Sparta… find Deimos. He… needs you.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Mother! What have I done?

Speaker: NARRATOR
Text: With her last breath, she released the weight of her burden and finally found the peace she had long sought, but for Kratos, the rage was almost palpable. Fate had once again pushed him to the brink of madness.
[GAMEPLAY]

Speaker: THERA
Text: It has been long since our kind waited for the one destined to free us. Gaia foretold of our salvation, Ghost of Sparta.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I have not come here for your or your kind.

Speaker: THERA
Text: Do not be so naive, Kratos. Your path led you to me. You need my help.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I need nothing from you, Thera.

Speaker: THERA
Text: If you do not free me, then you will share my fate. You will die here, with me. Free me. Free me and my power will be yours. Without it, we will both remain prisoners of our torments.
[GAMEPLAY]
[GAMEPLAY]

Speaker: NARRATOR
Text: The battle with Scylla had shaken the very foundation of Poseidon’s kingdom. Atlantis was sinking. But that mattered little to the Ghost of Sparta.
[GAMEPLAY]

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Athena! You lie to to me! The Gods lie to me! My brother lives! Athena!!!

Speaker: ATHENA
Text: Don't let your rage blind you, Kratos. There is much you do not know. Be warned, they will all try to stop...

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Ahhhhhh!
[GAMEPLAY]

Speaker: DYING SOLDIER
Text: Hold fast, Dominus, we've won the battle. Hold fast.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: What happened here?

Speaker: DYING SOLDIER
Text: We have angered them... the gods… They sent a message to all who defy their glory. But we... we survived. Spared us… she… she...

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Who spared you?

Speaker: DYING SOLDIER
Text: The Daughter… a message... to the Ghost of Sparta. ...The Labor begins. ...Death… awaits the Ghost. He will never get the Skull. The Skull...

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I am coming for you, brother.
[GAMEPLAY]
[GAMEPLAY]

Speaker: GRAVE DIGGER
Text: What fools. What fool? And you...The biggest fool of all, Kratos. The Ghost of Sparta. The slayer of Ares, and now the destroyer of Atlantis. You should take heed, Spartan. The destruction of Poseidon's kingdom will not bode well on Olympus.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I care little for the gods.

Speaker: GRAVE DIGGER
Text: And yet you walk beside them?

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I did not ask for he throne of ares.

Speaker: GRAVE DIGGER
Text: You were given the honor to walk among the gods. And yet you spit on it like it was dirt.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: The gods can keep their honor. I wish only to find my brother. ‘

Speaker: GRAVE DIGGER
Text: Ah, yes. The other one. Try if you must, but you will not succeed. You will never find him. And in the wake of your destruction, you have sunk the only path to your salvation. This... is all that awaits you at the end of your journey.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Not before I find Deimos.

Speaker: GRAVE DIGGER
Text: Be wise, my son... And turn back now. Do not seek the Domain of Death.
[GAMEPLAY]

Speaker: YOUNG KRATOS
Text: Don’t let you guard down, Deimos.  A Spartan warrior never lets his back hit the ground. Even in death, a Spartan stands tall for battle. You are a Spartan, are you not???
[GAMEPLAY]

Speaker: THE DAUGHTER
Text: Ghost of Sparta?

Speaker: SOLDIER
Text: I don't now where he is. Please… I swear to you...

Speaker: THE DAUGHTER
Text: Tell us.
[GAMEPLAY]

Speaker: SOLDIER
Text: My lord, I knew you would return. I have not failed you. I told the servants of Death nothing. Elysium. Elysium…

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: You are a Spartan. Even in death you stand tall for battle.

Speaker: SOLDIER
Text: Thank you, Lord Kratos.
[SOLDIER’S CORPSE]
[GAMEPLAY]

Speaker: NARRATOR
Text: Erinys… the daughter of Thanatos, the God of Death. Pain given form, evil given life.

Speaker: ERINYS
Text: Ghost of Sparta. The God Slayer. Your brother belongs to Thanatos. So does your blood.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: You cannot stop me. Nothing can.
[GAMEPLAY]

Speaker: YOUNG KRATOS
Text: A Spartan warrior never lets his back hit the ground. Even in death, a Spartan stands tall for battle. You are a Spartan, are you not?

Speaker: NARRATOR
Text: The Oracle had foretold the demise of the Olympian Gods, and the destruction of Olympus. She saw that it would brought about not by the hands of the Titans, who thirsted for revenge, but by the hands of a mortal, a marked warrior. Whoever controlled the marked warrior... controlled the fate of Olympus.

Speaker: ATHENA
Text: (god’s language) Enough! Father sent us here to bring the marked one, this boy is of no consequence.

Speaker: ARES
Text: (god’s language) You see so little of what is true, Athena. STEP ASIDE!!

Speaker: ATHENA
Text: (god’s language) I said, the boy is not to be touched. Now take the marked one, and leave!

Speaker: YOUNG DEIMOS
Text: Kratos! Help! Kratos!

Speaker: ATHENA
Text: Forgive me.

Speaker: YOUNG DEIMOS
Text: Help!

Speaker: YOUNG KRATOS
Text: Deimos!

Speaker: MOTHER
Text: Kratos! Deimos! Where are you? Come home, my sons!

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Deimos... I will find you.
[GAMEPLAY]

Speaker: CAPTAIN
Text: My Lord! We shall make quick work of this and erect a statue befitting of your glory. That's right men. Now pull! All hail Lord Kratos, the God of War!

Speaker: SOLDIERS
Text: All hail Lord Kratos!

Speaker: CAPTAIN
Text: My Lord. I have something for you. I shall return.
[At the door to the temple he is met by the face of Ares.]

Speaker: ARES
Text: Face thyself, and your fate shall be sealed.

Speaker: NARRATOR
Text: Kratos stood in the temple of ares. It was a somber reminder of who and where had become. The Ghost of Sparta, the God Slayer. And now the very person he had once despised, the God of War.
[GAMEPLAY]

Speaker: NARRATOR
Text: Kratos knew he had to return to Atlantis, back to the sunken city. Only there would he find the entrance to Death's Domain, and the brother he left behind.

Speaker: CAPTAIN
Text: Your weapons, my Lord. I have looked after them as if they were my own.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: You have served me well.

Speaker: CAPTAIN
Text: Thank you, my Lord.
[GAMEPLAY]

Speaker: Dead Soldier
Text: Be warned Ghost of Sparta. Do not pursue this path, the Gods forbid it.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: The gods have no power over me, Thanatos. Where is my brother?

Speaker: Dead Soldier
Text: If you persist, not even the Fates will prevent me from ending your path.

Speaker: Dead Soldier
Text: Ares was unwise to believe you could serve him.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Do not stand in my way, Thanatos. Or Ares' blood is not the only I will shed.
[Dead soldier laughs and dies again.]
[GAMEPLAY]

Speaker: KING MIDAS
Text: No! Leave me alone!
[GAMEPLAY]

Speaker: KING MIDAS
Text: Stay away!!! Stay away!! I’m cursed! Stay away! Don't you see? Everything I touch... Gold.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Midas?

Speaker: KING MIDAS
Text: I... I didn't mean to. I thought... How... How could I know that she would... Oh, my daughter... My beautiful little girl...
[Distraught completely, he begins to think that the river of lava before him is the River Styx.]

Speaker: KING MIDAS
Text: The River Styx... I am in Hades? I must be! Finally I know that I must do!
[He touches lava. It turns to gold, but his hand burned out.]

Speaker: KING MIDAS
Text: Augh, no, no... Aaah!!!
[He runs away. Kratos finds him, beats him up and throws him into lava to turn it into gold and cross to the other side.]
[Kratos set sail to the city of Atlantis.]

Speaker: NARRATOR
Text: Kratos knew that deep within the raging abyss lay the answer to a question he was not yet prepared to ask. Was Deimos still alive?
[Kratos sails to the dilapidated and submerged Atlantis. He is met by the huge head of the statue of the god of the seas, Poseidon.]

Speaker: POSEIDON
Text: You have desecrated my kingdom. I shall not forget this, Ghost of Sparta. You will answer for this affront.
[Kratos reads a description on the statue]
[Reaching Ancient Atlantis, he sees a multitude of violently roaring waterfalls and giant statues next to them. Their description reads as follows.]
[In the next room he comes to the statues of Athena.]

Speaker: ATHENA
Text: It is not too late to turn back, Kratos. No good will come of this journey. The Gods...

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I am done with the gods. Return to Olympus and leave me be.

Speaker: ATHENA
Text: Your brother was a threat to Olympus, Kratos. What was done… had to be done. Forgive me.
[Kratos recalls the day his brother was kidnapped.]

Speaker: ATHENA
Text: Forgive me.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: You were there? Why? Why didn't you help him?

Speaker: ATHENA
Text: I was there for you, Kratos. You had to be saved.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: You should have saved him. I should have saved him.

Speaker: ATHENA
Text: There is more to this than you could possibly know, Kratos.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Lies and riddles. That’s all you give me, Athena. I will save my brother, and you will stay out of my way.
[He activates the Nexus and open a path to Death Gate.]

Speaker: NARRATOR
Text: The Domain of Death. A dark netherworld, nestled between the land of living, and the real of the dead. A purgatory ruled by the God of Death, Thanatos.
[He goes deep into the Hall of the Damnation...]

Speaker: NARRATOR
Text: The doors to the Domain of Death. Nor god had dared enter. Worshipped long before the Olympians, Thanatos, the God of Death, dwelled within.
[On the door to his temple a face of Thanatos himself speak to Kratos.]

Speaker: THANATOS
Text: Free thyself, and your past shall be forgiven.
[Book at the entrance.]
[Kratos solve some puzzles, tear some enemies apart and finally finds his brother.]

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Deimos…
[He frees him from the shackles.]

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Brother, you are safe now.

Speaker: DEIMOS
Text: SAFE?! You let this happen to me! You were supposed to protect me! Did you think I would forget? Did you think I would forgive? I will never forgive you, brother.
[The have a fight. Deimos gets his brother ass kicked.]

Speaker: DEIMOS
Text: You left me! Get get up! Fight me! I hate you, Kratos!
[Suddenly Thanatos appears, grab Deimos and goes to throw him into the abyss.]

Speaker: THANATOS
Text: You killed my daughter, spartan! And now you will suffer for it!
[He actually throws Deimos, but picks him up in flies away somewhere.]

Speaker: DEIMOS
Text: AAAAAH!

[Tired of fighting, Kratos finds the strength to rise and jumps after his brother. He sees his brother fighting Thanatos on the edge of a cliff. Kratos helps him and Deimos finds the strength to forgive his brother.]

Speaker: DEIMOS
Text: A spartan never lets his back hit the ground. Right, brother?

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I will not lose your again, Deimos. Come. The fight is not over.
[He give his brother the Arms of Sparta. Now he can aid Kratos in battle!]

Speaker: THANATOS
Text: The oracle may have yet spoken truth. The marked warrior shall bring about the destruction of Olympus. Ares chose poorly that day. He took your brother when it should have been you. None of that matters now. Nothing you do is of your own choosing.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: The gods do not decide my fate, Thanatos!

Speaker: THANATOS
Text: The gods decide… And the Sisters of Fate make it so! You are nothing but a pawn in a game you don't even know is being played. Pathetic. Now is the time, Kratos... The beginning of the end.
[They have an epic fight. Kratos and Deimos side by side, crushing a god. In the end Deimos make a jump and pierce Thanatos’s eye, but he catch him and smash him into the ground.]

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Deimos!
[Kratos looses his mind in rage and destroy Thanatos. He takes the body of his brother in his arms and carries along the Path of Solitude.]

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: You are free now… brother.
[The gravedigger (from the first game) begin to prepare a new grave. Kratos comes to an edge of the cliff...]

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: By the gods, what have I become?

Speaker: THE GRAVEDIGGER
Text: Death. The destroyer... of worlds.

Speaker: ATHENA
Text: It is done. You have let go of that which made you mortal. Your ties to this world are severed. You are ready… to be a god.
[He touches his head and start to transfer gods powers, but Kratos refuses.]

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Is this all a game to you, Athena?!!! Its not over, Athena. The gods will pay for this.

Speaker: ATHENA
Text: Forgive me... brother.
[Additional scene. The Gravedigger put the body of Kratos’s mother to a grave.]

Speaker: THE GRAVEDIGGER
Text: Now, only one remains…
